text:
Data Cloud is a platform
which allows businesses
to unify all their customer data, so

that they can have a
trustful, comprehensive view

of all their customers
in a single experience.

As a part of Salesforce Data
Cloud, there were a couple
of challenges that we saw

that we could see the Storage
Browser for S3 address for us,

primarily around the
lines of data management
and navigation, to remove data silos,

and enable an easier
access for file management.

The solution that we
will be developing on top

of Storage Browser for Amazon
S3 will help our customers

more seamlessly connect
with their external sources,
specifically their S3 tenants.

We will be able to provide
our customers a single source

of truth for all their
unstructured data and files
within the Salesforce platform,
along with provisioning data access for them,

and also help our customers
browse, upload, download, copy,

and delete their files
within the Data Cloud platform.

Best of all, all of this would
be made possible in a simple
and intuitive interface.
Building on AWS ensures both our customers

and developers alike are using
services that scale with ease
and are reliable in nature,
and it also makes sure

that our developers are no
longer focusing on managing
and developing IT infrastructure

and can actually focus on
creating true customer value.

Creating unified and easy to
use experiences are critical
to our team at Data Cloud,
and we are always exploring new ways

to provide the best
experience for our customers.

And we see the Storage Browser
for S3 as one of these tools
that we can leverage

and benefit from to
deliver the experiences
that our customers desire.
